intro: Amsinckia purpusii, commonly known as the California fiddleneck, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine pubescence. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and along roadsides. Amsinckia purpusii is also valued for its ecological role in supporting pollinators and its ornamental appeal in native plant gardens.
